_prev_prog_3.Description:
Schreiber Foods, Inc. implementation of the PSM program includes employee education in the hazards of

ammonia and measures that can be used to reduce employee and community exposure to accidental

ammonia releases. The plan includes a regular preventive maintenance program (mechanical integrity) for

the ammonia system components, and a program for both pre-startup safety reviews and management of

changes (MOC) to the ammonia refrigeration system. The program also includes operating procedures for the

safe operation of the refrigeration system, specific requirements for safe work practices (such as safe

approaches to welding and similar hot work), and safety requirements for contractors who may be hired to

work on the refrigeration system. Schreiber Foods has a procedure in place for investigating incidents to

ensure root causes are identified and corrective actions are taken to minimize the potential for recurrence of

incidents. The program also has a procedure for conducting compliance audits to ensure the PSM program is

being implemented at the Fairview facility. Lastly, the PSM written program incorporates the Schreiber

Foods facility's emergency response plan and places special emphasis on handling accidental releases of

ammonia and coordination of emergency response with local fire departments and other emergency

response organizations.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.0      EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



This document has been prepared to document how Schreiber Foods complies with the requirements set forth under EPA's Chemical Accidental Prevention Provisions (40 CFR Part 68).  



This plan has been developed specifically to address the requirements applicable to the use of anhydrous ammonia at Schreiber Foods located at 1112 West Fairview Avenue in Carthage, Missouri. Each of the following sections provides a general overview of the requirements and defines the design attributes, documentation, and actions that are established to comply with those requirements.  In most instances, Schreiber Foods has already developed measures and systems that provide compliance with 40 CFR Part 68 rules as a result of other regulatory programs and requirements.  This document does not replicate that information but rather provides cross-references to the applicable existing documentation.  In those instances where information was developed specifically to comply with the Part 68 requirements, that information is contained in this document.



1.1.     Corporate Commitment to Safety



Schreiber Foods is committed in providing to all employees a work environment that is free from recognized health and safety hazards.  Accordingly, our goal is achieving and sustaining a"Zero Accident Tolerance" through communication, information, and training.  To this end, we are dedicated to the concept that all employees receive the proper orientation and are provided with the means necessary to ensure the environment remains as safe and healthful as possible.





1.1.1.     It is the policy of Schreiber Foods to:



1.1.1.1     Provide safe working conditions, proper tools, and personal protective equipment.



1.1.1.2     Comply with all federal, state, and local occupational health, safety, and environmental laws and regulations.



1.1.1.3     Provide and sustain a high level of commitment to ensure all employees have a safe and healthy work environment in which to work.



1.1

.1.4     Ensure, through training, and when necessary corrective action, that all employees work in a safe manner.



1.1.1.5     Educate and/or train all employees in safe work practices, and ensure that each employee fully understands his or her job, equipment, techniques, and methods to reduce the risk to himself or herself and their co-workers.



1.1.2.     Encourage all employees to "Think Safety", so that safety habits developed and practiced at work carry through to non-work related activities.



1.1.3.     Schreiber Foods?s aim is to provide a professional service as efficiently as possible while minimizing the use of toxic materials whereever and whenever prudent.  In this effort our highest priority will be the proactive pursuit of cost-effective process changes that reduce or eliminate the use and/or generation of hazardous toxics at the endpoint of service.  Where hazardous toxics cannot be eliminated, improving controls to handle these substances will be explored and implemented wherever possible.



1.1.4.     Schreiber Foods has prepared a facility safety policy and procedures program specifically tailored for the facility. In addition, a Process Safety Management Program has also been established and implemented regarding the ammonia refrigeration system process.  It is the responsibility of the designated facility personnel to carry out these programs.



1.1.5.     The first duty of Schreiber Foods employees is to exercise care in the performance of his/her work tasks to prevent an accident to him/herself, co-workers, the general public or equipment.  Safety-consciousness must take precedence over expedience, and is required as a condition of continued employment of all employees at all levels of the organization.



1.2.     Schreiber Foods Facility Description



Schreiber Foods, Inc., Fairview Facility, is responsible for the production, cold storage and distribution of various cheese food products. The facility is located in the immediate vicinity of the Carthage

community. The facility employs approximately 375 employees.



1.2.1.     The substance regulated under the Chemical Accident Prevention  Provisions (40 CFR 68) that is located on site, in various locations and quantities is anhydrous ammonia.



1.2.2.     Anhydrous ammonia is utilized on site for the "Refrigeration System." The ammonia is contained in various vessels, piping, condensers and evaporators used throughout the ammonia refrigeration system.  



1.3.     Worst Case Release Scenario



1.3.1.     As stipulated in EPA guidelines, 40 CFR Part 68.25(b)(1) the worst-case release scenario was calculated and the results are on file at the Fairview facility. 



1.4.     Alternate Case Release Scenario



1.4.1.     The alternative release scenario was also calculated according to the EPA guidelines and is on file at the facility. 



1.5.     Emergency Response Program



1.5.1.     Schreiber Foods is equipped with an emergency information system.  Evacuation plans are placed throughout the facility to inform personnel in an emergency relating to the accidental release of ammonia, or other emergencies that may be encountered.  There are specific procedures that all employees must follow in the event of release. Procedures can be found in the Schreiber Foods Emergency Response Plan.  These procedures include evacuation of personnel, notification of authorities, and actions to be taken to stop, or mitigate the emergency.  Emergencies involving ammonia releases will be handled by a Schreiber Foods internal Hazmat Team.



1.5.2. Schreiber personnel have received required emergency response training as outlined in OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.120(q).



1.5.3.     The Carthage Fire Department has visited the facility to review the process operations, safety systems and discussed emergency response coordination.
